name: Yellow-billed Teal
description: Easily recognized from other teals by its yellow, slightly curved beak. Even males are a subdued brown and don’t molt into a duller plumage after breeding.
spread_note: Coastal areas of western South America
food_note: Small aquatic invertebrates, parts of aquatic plants
reproduction: The female lays 5–8 eggs, incubation lasts 26–28 days.
attractions: Forms flocks of 10–20 birds, occasionally up to 200. Nests hidden in dense vegetation and tree hollows.
